page.title: 17ROWSLEY AND BEELEY
page.content:
ROWSLEY AND BEELEY
OUR BLOCK HAS GOT QUITE A LOT OF WOODS AND ROUGH GRAZING LAND.IN THOSE WOODS THERE ARE LARCH AND QUITE A LOT OF PINE TREES.THERE ARE OPEN FIELDS NEAR A VILLAGE CALLED BEELEY. NEAR BEELEY THERE ARE ALOT OF FARMS AND ANIMALS IN THE FIELD.WE GROW CROPS AT FARMS TO EAT LIKE POTEOTOES AND CARROTS.NEAR BEELEY RUNS THE RIVER DERWENT IT ALMOST GOES STRAIGHT THOUGH OUR RECTANGLE.WHEN WE WENT ON OUR WALK WE STOPPED AT A PLACE CALLED CHATSWORTH WHICH HAS SHEEP AND COWS ON THE LOOSE.WE HAVE ONLY GOT HALF OF CHATSWORTH IN OUR AREA.THERE IS A PLACE CALLED LEES MOOR WOOD WHICH IS VERY BIG.
